content.description:
This is a great sport route in a sunny pocket away from the crowds. A distinct crux occurs moving past the second bolt from a powerful undercling. Solid, slightly overhanging edges lead to the top.

This fun route deserves more traffic, even though the large undercling feature may not be able to handle it.

Powerslave is the name of the 5th album from the band Iron Maiden (1984).
content.protection: 4 bolts with a two bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
Powerslave is on a sub boulder in the Poetry Rock clump. From the

The Balcony

area of the Jimmy Cliffs this route is located on a wall in the Poetry clump you can see before the prominent spire. From afar it looks like a half height boulder against a larger pillar. When one gets closer the formations resolve themselves into distinct features.

The route isn't listed in Joshua Tree West, the Miramontes Guide, or Barlett's (although I didn't check the 2nd version).

content.description: Steep face climbing takes you to the top of the pinnacle.  The moves are fun, but the rock is quite fragile.  There is no fixed anchor on top, although you can place gear.  One climber can rap down one side and anchor the rope, allowing the second climber to rap down the other side.
content.protection: There is a button-head bolt with no hanger.  Bring a thin wired nut for a makeshift hanger.  You can also place some gear.
content.location: On the west face of the pinacle.
